text.text: BBC Culture | Arts, Film & TV, Reviews, Books, Music, Style Skip to content British Broadcasting Corporation Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Film & TV Music Art & Design Style Books Entertainment News Home News Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK UK Politics England N. Ireland N. Ireland Politics Scotland Scotland Politics Wales Wales Politics Africa Asia China India Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Sport Business Executive Lounge Technology of Business Future of Business Innovation Technology Science & Health Artificial Intelligence AI v the Mind Culture Film & TV Music Art & Design Style Books Entertainment News Arts Arts in Motion Travel Destinations Africa Antarctica Asia Australia and Pacific Caribbean & Bermuda Central America Europe Middle East North America South America World’s Table Culture & Experiences Adventures The SpeciaList Earth Natural Wonders Weather & Science Climate Solutions Sustainable Business Green Living Audio Podcast Categories Radio Audio FAQs Video BBC Maestro Live Live News Live Sport Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Weather Newsletters Culture Euphoria creator teases new storylines for the show's third season Zendaya, Sydney Sweeney, Jacob Elordi among stars back in the HBO drama after four years. Five miracles of Christ painting sold for £5.7m The 15th-Century painting exceeds Sotheby's valuation of between £2.5m and £3.5m. Euphoria creator teases new storylines for the show's third season Zendaya, Sydney Sweeney, Jacob Elordi among stars back in the HBO drama after four years. Five miracles of Christ painting sold for £5.7m The 15th-Century painting exceeds Sotheby's valuation of between £2.5m and £3.5m. Steve Cropper, guitarist of Booker T and the MGs, dies aged 84 The musician was known for his work on hits including Green Onions and Otis Redding’s The Dock of the Bay. The 'It Girl' style wars of Renaissance Italy During a turbulent period of Italian history, some noblewomen used flamboyant, luxurious looks to gain soft power. Five hundred years later, they continue to influence designers. Eight paint colours that can transform your home As Pantone announces its colour of 2026, here's more on the reasoning behind the choice – and what other trending shades can help you achieve greater domestic bliss. Steve Cropper, guitarist of Booker T and the MGs, dies aged 84 The musician was known for his work on hits including Green Onions and Otis Redding’s The Dock of the Bay. The 'It Girl' style wars of Renaissance Italy During a turbulent period of Italian history, some noblewomen used flamboyant, luxurious looks to gain soft power. Five hundred years later, they continue to influence designers. Desert Island Discs Desert Island Discs Lorraine Kelly, broadcaster Save Desert Island Discs Lennie James, actor Save Desert Island Discs Mary Greenwell, makeup artist Save Desert Island Discs Ronnie Wood, musician Save Desert Island Discs Angela Harding, artist Save Desert Island Discs Michael Sheen, actor Save Desert Island Discs Maggie Alphonsi, broadcaster and former rugby player Save Desert Island Discs Professor Dame Carol Robinson, scientist Save Desert Island Discs Harry Hill, comedian Save Desert Island Discs Monica Dolan, actor Save Entertainment news Miley Cyrus confirms engagement to musician Maxx Morando Misha Glenny to replace Bragg as In Our Time host Netflix hits back at Diddy's criticism of 'shameful' documentary Gary Lineker takes football podcast to Netflix Watch list 12 of the best films to watch this December From the third instalment of the Avatar phenomenon to a Timothée Chalamet-starring awards contender – these are the films to watch at the cinema and stream at home this month. Nine of the best TV shows to watch this December From Netflix's new female-led Western with Lena Headey and Gillian Anderson to the return of post-apocalyptic hit Fallout and the final ever episodes of Stranger Things. From our Culture editors Why UK countryside style has been big this year From the Princess of Wales to "Rich Autumn Dad", and from houndstooth to Fair Isle, "country-coded" clothing is everywhere. And it looks set to continue its reign – but why? Marty Supreme is 'fresh, funny and exhilarating' ★★★★☆ Timothée Chalamet is "captivating", alongside an "impeccable" Gwyneth Paltrow, in this "madcap" film about a young man who scams and steals his way to becoming a table-tennis champion. The long, strange success of the Grateful Dead The band performed their first concert on 4 December 1965. In 1981, their leader Jerry Garcia talked to the BBC about how they became superstars but "never sold out". This Indigenous winter scene is not what it seems Satirical artist Wendy Red Star is debunking myths and upending cliches about First Nation and Native people. Now two exhibitions are featuring her work. Oscar-tipped Hamnet is moving but 'manipulative' ★★☆☆☆ The Shakespeare drama starring Paul Mescal and Jessie Buckley has a stellar cast but is "exploitative" and lacks subtlety. Stranger Things' final series is 'thrilling' ★★★★☆ The Netflix sci-fi is back after a three-year wait, with its young stars now in their 20s – and the first four episodes of this final season suggest an "all-time ending" is in store. In History How the Cabbage Patch Kids nearly caused a riot Xavier Roberts' cuddly-toy business grew into a billion-dollar empire in the space of a few years. Why did these dolls have Christmas shoppers scrambling to buy them in 1983? The shocking downfall of Margaret Thatcher In November 1990, the UK's prime minister made her tearful departure from 10 Downing Street. She was ousted by her own party, having been weakened by an unlikely enemy. Why the teenage David Bowie was already a rebel On 12 November 1964, the would-be pop star told the BBC that cruelty to long-haired men "just has to stop" – a stunt that hinted at his unconventional spirit. The story behind Elizabeth Taylor's 1966 TV meltdown Richard Burton, born 100 years ago this month, was famously married - twice - to Elizabeth Taylor. In 1966, a BBC interview with them saw a furious Taylor come to her husband's aid. Princess Margaret's forbidden first love Elizabeth II's sister had to choose between ending her engagement and renouncing her title in 1955. Or did she? In 1978, the BBC talked to the war hero who almost married a princess. 'Awop-bop-aloobop alop-bam-boom!': Why Little Richard's Tutti Frutti was so risqué When the single was released in 1955, it was a big hit – but only after the original lyrics were changed. In 1972, the singer told the BBC that "there's nothing bad" about his music. Arts in Motion Elif Shafak says her writing style is 'a little bit drunk' British-Turkish novelist Elif Shafak tells the BBC her writing is guided by intuition rather than a rigid plan. 'Architecture is about allowing the extraordinary to happen' Beirut-born architect Lina Ghotmeh's vision for every structure is to honour their surroundings and history. Brian Cox on why you should keep your inner child alive Acclaimed actor Brian Cox shares his journey from a challenging childhood to global acting success. Yuja Wang: 'I really do not want to practise' Yuja Wang is one of the most exciting pianists of the 21st century. She credits falling in love with the piano to an early infatuation with the great Polish composer, Frédéric Chopin. The Paris Opera wants you to 'feel first, understand later' Go behind the scenes of the historic Paris Opera to discover why no prep is required to experience opera. More Culture 1 hr ago Barnsley to host art festival's 10th edition AND Festival will take place between 25 and  27 September 2026 1 hr ago 7 hrs ago Venue given £1.92m to open creative digital lab The new space will include video production, live recording and podcast facilities once refurbished. 7 hrs ago 7 hrs ago Joan Armatrading choral work celebrates Birmingham Singer-songwriter Joan Armatrading says Homeland focuses on Birmingham, her home since 1958. 7 hrs ago 7 hrs ago Support for renaming airport after Ozzy grows More than 77,000 people have now signed a petition calling for Birmingham airport to be renamed. 7 hrs ago 7 hrs ago 'I can't wait to make my Northern Irish debut' - Opera star Tara Erraught The internationally acclaimed singer performs at Londonderry's St Columb's Hall on Thursday. 7 hrs ago 7 hrs ago US Girl Scout selling family's valuable painting to help Highland museum Amelia Cimbalo hopes to raise thousands of pounds for the West Highland Museum in Fort William. 7 hrs ago 13 hrs ago Eurovision faces crucial decision over Israel Organisers of the song contest meet in Geneva on Thursday to debate Israel's role in the event. 13 hrs ago 18 hrs ago Brits Critics' Choice nominees revealed The award showcases up-and-coming talent selected by a panel of industry experts. 18 hrs ago 18 hrs ago Cold War tank reports for duty at museum The armoured vehicle, used by local units, is to be a "gate guardian" outside the entrance. 18 hrs ago ...
